verbs.englishDefinition: to give a task or responsibility to another person
verbs.englishExampleSentence: She delegated the task to her assistant.
The new software will improve efficiency.

verbs.englishDefinition: to introduce something new or make changes in something existing
verbs.englishExampleSentence: The company is known for its ability to innovate.

verbs.englishDefinition: to give someone a reason for doing something
verbs.englishExampleSentence: The coach was able to motivate the team to win.

verbs.englishDefinition: to make the best or most effective use of something
verbs.englishExampleSentence: The process was optimized for efficiency.

verbs.englishDefinition: to decide which tasks are more important and need to be done first
verbs.englishExampleSentence: It's important to prioritize tasks in order to meet deadlines.

verbs.englishDefinition: to achieve the desired aim or result
verbs.englishExampleSentence: She succeeded in her new role.

verbs.englishDefinition: to help someone or something by giving them the things they need
verbs.englishExampleSentence: The team supported each other throughout the project.

verbs.englishDefinition: to follow the progress or development of something
verbs.englishExampleSentence: The software can track changes in real-time.

verbs.englishDefinition: to make something more modern or up to date
to check that something is true or accurate
verbs.englishExampleSentence: The documents need to be verified before processing.

verbs.englishDefinition: to do a job or activity that requires effort
verbs.englishExampleSentence: She worked late to finish the project on time.

nouns.englishExampleSentence: The deadline for the project is next Friday.
nouns.englishDefinition: the latest time or date by which something should be completed

nouns.englishExampleSentence: Improving efficiency is a key goal for the company.
nouns.englishDefinition: the ability to do something well with the minimum of time and effort

nouns.englishExampleSentence: Setting clear goals can help increase productivity.
nouns.englishDefinition: something that you want to achieve

nouns.englishExampleSentence: Her performance at work has been consistently excellent.
nouns.englishDefinition: how well or badly you do something

nouns.englishExampleSentence: Increasing productivity is a priority for the team.
nouns.englishDefinition: the rate at which goods are produced

nouns.englishExampleSentence: The quality of the products has improved significantly.
nouns.englishDefinition: how good or bad something is

nouns.englishExampleSentence: The results of the survey will be presented next week.
nouns.englishDefinition: something that happens or exists because of something else

nouns.englishExampleSentence: We need to stick to the schedule to meet the deadline.
nouns.englishDefinition: a plan of things that will be done and when they will be done

nouns.englishExampleSentence: She completed the task ahead of schedule.
nouns.englishDefinition: a piece of work that needs to be done

nouns.englishExampleSentence: Effective teamwork is crucial for the success of the project.
nouns.englishDefinition: the combined action of a group of people, especially when effective and efficient

nouns.englishExampleSentence: She's feeling overwhelmed by her heavy workload.
nouns.englishDefinition: the amount of work that a person has to do

adjectives.englishExampleSentence: He is known for his efficient work process.
adjectives.englishDefinition: achieving maximum productivity with minimum wasted effort or expense

adjectives.englishExampleSentence: She is very effective in managing her team.
adjectives.englishDefinition: successful in producing a desired or intended result

adjectives.englishExampleSentence: The team delivered an excellent performance.
The new system has made the team more productive.
adjectives.englishDefinition: producing or able to produce large amounts of goods, crops, or other commodities

adjectives.englishExampleSentence: The company is known for its high-quality products.
adjectives.englishDefinition: the standard of something as measured against other things of a similar kind; the degree of excellence of something

adjectives.englishExampleSentence: He is a reliable employee who always meets deadlines.
adjectives.englishDefinition: consistently good in quality or performance; able to be trusted

adjectives.englishExampleSentence: The project was a successful collaboration between teams.
Her timely intervention prevented a major issue.
adjectives.englishDefinition: done or occurring at a favorable or useful time; opportune

adjectives.englishExampleSentence: His insights were valuable in improving the process.
adjectives.englishDefinition: worth a great deal of money; extremely useful or important

adjectives.englishExampleSentence: Regular feedback is vital for employee development.
The team came up with a workable solution to the problem.
adjectives.englishDefinition: able to be done or put into practice successfully

adjectives.englishExampleSentence: The new system has made the team more productive.
adjectives.englishDefinition: producing or able to produce large amounts of goods, crops, or other commodities

collocations.englishDefinition: to complete a task or project by the agreed-upon time
collocations.englishExampleSentence: It's important to meet deadlines in order to maintain good work performance.

collocations.englishDefinition: to make something work better and faster
collocations.englishExampleSentence: Implementing new software can help improve efficiency in the workplace.

collocations.englishDefinition: to increase the amount of work that can be done in a certain amount of time
collocations.englishExampleSentence: Regular breaks can help boost productivity among employees.

collocations.englishDefinition: to reach specific goals or objectives
collocations.englishExampleSentence: Setting clear targets can help employees achieve their goals.

collocations.englishDefinition: to continue working at a high level of effectiveness
collocations.englishExampleSentence: Regular training sessions can help employees maintain high performance levels.

collocations.englishDefinition: to produce more goods or services
collocations.englishExampleSentence: Investing in new equipment can help increase output in the factory.

collocations.englishDefinition: to make the process of work more efficient and streamlined
collocations.englishExampleSentence: Implementing new technology can help optimize workflow in the office.

collocations.englishDefinition: to improve the quality or quantity of work
collocations.englishExampleSentence: Regular feedback can help enhance performance among employees.

collocations.englishDefinition: to do more or better than was expected
collocations.englishExampleSentence: By going above and beyond, employees can exceed expectations set by the company.

collocations.englishDefinition: to improve the confidence and motivation of a group of people
collocations.englishExampleSentence: Team-building activities can help boost morale in the workplace.

idioms.englishDefinition: To work late into the night
idioms.englishExampleSentence: I've been burning the midnight oil to finish this project on time.

idioms.englishDefinition: To start something with great energy and enthusiasm
idioms.englishExampleSentence: She hit the ground running in her new job and quickly impressed her colleagues.

idioms.englishDefinition: To work a lot of hours
idioms.englishExampleSentence: Success doesn't come easily, you have to put in the hours to achieve your goals.

idioms.englishDefinition: To make a special effort to achieve something
idioms.englishExampleSentence: He always goes the extra mile to make sure his work is of the highest quality.

idioms.englishDefinition: To meet the challenge or expectations of a situation
idioms.englishExampleSentence: Despite the pressure, she rose to the occasion and delivered an outstanding presentation.
idioms.idiomTranslation: подняться на высоту и справиться с задачей

prepositionalVerbs.englishDefinition: to do something that you did not have time to do earlier
prepositionalVerbs.englishExampleSentence: I need to catch up on my emails before the meeting.

prepositionalVerbs.englishDefinition: to think of an idea, plan, or solution
prepositionalVerbs.englishExampleSentence: We need to come up with a new marketing strategy.

prepositionalVerbs.englishDefinition: to be more successful than others in a competitive situation
prepositionalVerbs.englishExampleSentence: He works hard to get ahead of his colleagues.

prepositionalVerbs.englishDefinition: to stay at the same level or standard as someone or something
prepositionalVerbs.englishExampleSentence: It's hard to keep up with all the changes in technology.

prepositionalVerbs.englishDefinition: to feel happy and excited about something that is going to happen
prepositionalVerbs.englishExampleSentence: I'm looking forward to the new project.

prepositionalVerbs.englishDefinition: to delay doing something until a later time
prepositionalVerbs.englishExampleSentence: I keep putting off cleaning the house.

prepositionalVerbs.englishDefinition: to use all of something so that there is none left
prepositionalVerbs.englishExampleSentence: We're going to run out of time if we don't hurry.

prepositionalVerbs.englishDefinition: to be very noticeable or different
prepositionalVerbs.englishExampleSentence: Her performance really stands out from the rest.

prepositionalVerbs.englishDefinition: to look after someone or something
prepositionalVerbs.englishExampleSentence: She takes care of all the administrative tasks.

prepositionalVerbs.englishDefinition: to spend time improving a particular piece of work
prepositionalVerbs.englishExampleSentence: I need to work on my presentation for the meeting.

phrasalVerbs.englishDefinition: to record the time you arrive at work on a special machine
phrasalVerbs.englishExampleSentence: Don't forget to clock in when you arrive at the office.

phrasalVerbs.englishDefinition: to record the time you leave work on a special machine
phrasalVerbs.englishExampleSentence: Make sure to clock out before you leave for the day.

phrasalVerbs.translation: приступить к работе с полной отдачей
phrasalVerbs.englishDefinition: to start working hard and seriously
phrasalVerbs.englishExampleSentence: I need to knuckle down and finish this report by the end of the day.

phrasalVerbs.englishDefinition: to move forward or make progress faster than others
phrasalVerbs.englishExampleSentence: With his dedication and hard work, he managed to pull ahead of his competitors.

phrasalVerbs.englishDefinition: to increase the speed or rate of something
phrasalVerbs.englishExampleSentence: We need to speed up production in order to meet the deadline.

phrasalVerbs.englishDefinition: to accept or agree to do a particular task or deal with a particular responsibility
phrasalVerbs.englishExampleSentence: She decided to take on the new project despite her busy schedule.

phrasalVerbs.englishDefinition: to begin to have control or responsibility for something
phrasalVerbs.englishExampleSentence: The new manager will take over the team starting next month.

phrasalVerbs.englishDefinition: to develop or find a solution to a problem
phrasalVerbs.englishExampleSentence: I'm sure we can work out a compromise that will satisfy everyone.
